import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set_style('white')
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px
import datetime
from plotly.offline import init_notebook_mode, iplot
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)
source.05e15c0b:
for category in df['Category'].unique():
    mask = df[df['Category']== category]['Rating'].isna()
    mask = mask[mask==True]
    rating_median = df_drop_null_rating[df_drop_null_rating['Category'] == category]['Rating'].median()
    df.at[mask.index,'Rating'] = rating_median
source.b226b720:
pattern = re.compile('[+,M]')
df['Install No.'] = df['Installs'].apply(lambda x: pattern.sub('',x))
df['Install No.'] = df['Install No.'].astype(int)
df['Size'] = df['Size'].apply(lambda x: pattern.sub('',x))
df['Size']=pd.to_numeric(df['Size'],errors='coerce')
source.2b77e48a:
fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,7))
plt.ticklabel_format(style='plain', axis='y')
g1 = sns.barplot(data=data,x='Category',y='Install No.', ci=None)
ax1.set_xticklabels(ax1.get_xticklabels(),rotation=90)
ax2 = ax1.twinx()
g2 = sns.lineplot(data=data,x='Category',y='App', ci=None, linewidth = 2.5)
ax2.set(ylabel='Number of Apps')
source.47efade4:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(20,7))
df.value_counts('Type').plot.pie(y='Type',startangle=90, explode=(0.2,0), title='Percentage of the Free App and Paid App', legend=False, autopct='%.2f', ax=ax[0])
ax[0].set(ylabel='Type of Apps')
df.groupby('Type').agg({'Install No.':sum}).plot.pie(y='Install No.', startangle=90, explode=(0.2,0), title='Percentage of Installs Number for Free App and Paid App', legend=False, autopct='%.2f', ax=ax[1])
source.0f0e1ee3:
g = df.groupby('Category').agg({'Rating':'std'}).sort_values('Rating',ascending=False).plot(kind='bar',figsize=(20,7),title='Standard Deviation of the Ratings in Different Category')
g.set(ylabel='Standard Deviation')
source.644fdb91:
df['Install No.'] = df['Install No.'].astype(int)
df['Reviews'] = df['Reviews'].astype(int)
df_gb_insreviews = df.groupby('Category').agg({'Install No.':'sum','Reviews':'sum'})
source.a3956c9f:
plt.figure(figsize=(25,7))
g = df_gb_insreviews.sort_values('Percentage of reviews(%)', ascending=False)['Percentage of reviews(%)'].plot(kind='bar', title='Percentage of reviews in total install number')
g.set(ylabel='Percentage(%)')
source.ffe0b4e5: Users downloading "Comics" with higher rate to leave a review but with relative high spread of the rating comparing with others. "Comic" ranks 6 in the number of installation. The two categories with high download rate are having relatively low review rate.
source.dde6c2e2: The distribution of rating in free app and paid app are similar. The most densed rating is around 4.2.
source.ac7e4d04:
Comics has highest average sentiment popularity and the reviews are relatively subjective. 
The comments of two category with the highest install number, which are "Art and Design" and "Auto and Vehicles", are quite positive.
For the games ranks second in number of apps, the reviews are normally neutral and rank the last in sentiment popularity.
source.248fbafc: The **top two of the most installed** category are **"Art and Design" and "Auto and Vehicles"** but with approximately **having the **least number of apps**** among other categories in Google App Store. The install number of each of those categories are more than the sum of "Beauty" and "Books and Reference". Most of the apps belong to category of "Family", "Game" and "Tools" which are nearly 2000, 1250 and 900.
source.d0a2f8d2:
Sentiment_Polarity: The comment is postive or negative ranging from -1 to 1 and 0 stands for a neutral reviews. 

Sentiment_Subjectivity: Refers to whether the comment is subjective or objective ranging from 0 to 1, the higher the number represents more subjectives or involving more emotions.
source.b3c0a6e5: Android Ver, Current Ver, Type and Content Rating are contains a few of null values. The null value within those column will be dropped. Rating contains lots of null value, the null value will be filled according to the median of the corresponding category.
source.2ce82b01:
The column "Last Updated" is an object, the column need to be changed to datetime format.
The column "Installs" is also an object, it will be changed to integer.
source.f27a15fe: "Education" has the lowest standard deviation of the rating which means the spread of the rating in this category is narrower than others. On the other hand, "Lifestyle" is with the highest standard deviation. Sentiment analysis will be carrying out later.
source.0f177b2e: # App Category And Install Number
source.728fd7cf: # Data Cleaning #### Handling the null values and changing the data types for further analysis
source.0565d5f5: More than 92% of the are free in Google Play Store, and more than 99% of installs belongs to free apps. However, there is a bias in install number since it is not a exact number provided.
source.fff758cb: Change "Installs" and "Size" to numeric, some data containing strings in "Size", it will be replaced by NaN
